title: Researcher gets email updates on a private program after he/she quits that program.

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
I found out that after I quit private program, I still gets update about that program, e.g. new scope changes/amount of money and etc.

**Description (Include Impact):**
I noticed that if I quit program I still gets email updates about the private program, private data can be leak on that email.

### Steps To Reproduce
1. I got invite to █████ private program.
2. After period of time I quit that program.
3. I still get email updates about that program.

### soultions
1. Remove email address from program once hacker quit.
2. Set boolean flag, true/false once the user quit. (The flag can help once the user gets invite again or if he/she wants to rejoin).

Thanks,
Sasi

activities.message:
Hi Sasi,

Thanks for reporting this to us. We don't consider this to be a security issue, rather a functional bug. There are no concrete attack vectors here only the unexpected behavior of a message getting send out to a banned hacker or hacker that left the program.

From a teams perspective we understand that they don't want messages to be sent to a banned hacker, so we will implement filtering on this.

Please note that this probably won't be eligible for a bounty.

activities.message:
Hi @sasi2103,

We've resolved the issue you've reported, as well as cleaning up a few other possible cases as a result.

In our previous implementation, the "message hackers" feature specifically calls out "All hackers who have participated in your program", which would include anybody who has reported a vulnerability. We feel that there is a disconnect between what a hacker may want (especially if he/she left the program) vs. what a team was meaning, so we've reworded that setting to reflect that it only applies to hackers who are still invited to that private program. As this is just a UX issue, we consider this purely a functional bug.

While looking into this issue, we noticed that banned hackers would also be receiving team messages sent via this feature. While still not a security issue (as the language does say "All hackers"), we do feel that it does warrant a hacker receiving information that a team may not wish to provide them. We've corrected the issue so that any banned hackers won't receive messages from those teams.

Thanks again for this report, and we look forward to future reports from you.

Happy Halloween, and Happy Hacking!
